intro: Strychnos esquirolii, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces woody, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
